As a helpful assistant for teachers, I am here to provide you with relevant resources and activities for your lesson planning. Based on your request for a 12th grade level English lesson on the topic of "Derivation", here are a few suggestions:

1. Resource: "Derivative Rules" PDF Handout
Description: This handout provides an overview of the derivative rules in calculus, including the power rule, product rule, quotient rule, and chain rule.
Activity: Ask students to work through examples and practice problems using the derivative rules.

2. Resource: Khan Academy Calculus Videos
Description: Khan Academy offers a series of video lessons on calculus, including topics on derivatives. Search for "Khan Academy calculus derivative" on Google to find the relevant videos.
Activity: Assign specific videos for students to watch as part of homework or in-class discussions. Encourage them to take notes and ask questions.

3. Resource: "Derivative Worksheet" Template
Description: Use an online worksheet template or create your own derivative worksheet. Include a mix of basic and more challenging problems for students to solve.
Activity: Have students complete the worksheet individually or in small groups. Review the answers together and address any questions or difficulties they may have.

4. Resource: Online Interactive Practice
Description: Use interactive online platforms, such as Desmos or Calculus.org, to offer students practice exercises and quizzes on derivative calculations.
Activity: Direct students to the specific sections or activities related to derivative calculations. Monitor their progress and provide feedback as needed.

Remember, these are just a few examples. Feel free to adapt and modify them according to your specific needs and teaching style. You can also explore textbooks, additional online resources, or engage students in class discussions and experiments related to the topic of "Derivation". Let me know if you need any further assistance!
